definitions: Place (a seed, bulb, or plant) in the ground so that it can grow.
Place or fix in a specified position.
Place oneself or one's feet firmly in a particular position.
Hide or place something illicit among someone's belongings or in a particular place to incriminate them.
examples: She decided to plant roses in her garden.
He planted a kiss on her cheek.
The detective planted evidence at the scene.
They planted a bomb in the building.
